justifications: Yatsenyuk says he fears the U.K.'s exit from the EU could split the union, weaken Europe, trigger a domino effect and undermine trust in the European idea among Ukrainians.
"We need a united Europe," he said.

"Mr. President [Barack Obama] and the EU leaders, you are not allowed to lift sanctions against Russia until Russia fully implements Minsk [cease-fire agreement]. And until Ukraine takes over control of Luhansk, Donetsk, and Crimea. Full stop," Yatsenyuk said.
We are not just fighting for our borders....We are fighting for European borders, and for NATO member states' borders, too. And for peace and stability in Europe.
Ukrainian Prime Minister Arseny Yatsenyuk is welcomed by European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker, right, at the EU Commission headquarters in Brussels.

The government made an effort to reduce the power of oligarchs, he claimed, including Dmytro Firtash.
